column1:
Page(s) with URL(s) containing the above path(s) will not selected to apply lazy loading
Example: /gear.html
column2:
Page(s) with URL(s) containing the above path(s) will not selected to apply lazy loading
Example: /gear.html

column1:
Images including css class above will not be applied with lazy loading
Example: <img class="downloadable-product" src="lifelong.jpg"/>. If "downloadable-product" is excluded, the image will not be applied with lazy loading.
column2:
Images including css class above will not be applied with lazy loading
Example: <img class="downloadable-product" src="lifelong.jpg"/>. If "downloadable-product" is excluded, the image will not be applied with lazy loading.

column1:
Image title or image name contains the text above will not be applied with lazy loading
Example: <img title="lifelong-product" src="download.jpg"/> or <img alt="lifelong" src="lifelong.jpg"/> . If "lifelong" is an excluded text, this image is not applied with lazy loading.
column2:
Image title or image name contains the text above will not be applied with lazy loading
Example: <img title="lifelong-product" src="download.jpg"/> or <img alt="lifelong" src="lifelong.jpg"/> . If "lifelong" is an excluded text, this image is not applied with lazy loading.

column1:
When no threshold is set, images will immediately load when they appear on screen. Defining a threshold (in pixels) will start pre-loading any images that appear outside the viewport
For example, if the threshold is 200px, the image load appears within 200px from the viewport.
column2:
When no threshold is set, images will immediately load when they appear on screen. Defining a threshold (in pixels) will start pre-loading any images that appear outside the viewport
For example, if the threshold is 200px, the image load appears within 200px from the viewport.

column1:
Upload loading icon. Support gif, jpg, svg, png. If no file is chosen, the default icon will be used.
Recommended: 64x64 px
column2:
Upload loading icon. Support gif, jpg, svg, png. If no file is chosen, the default icon will be used.
Recommended: 64x64 px
